alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:39AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cherry, northeastern Hooker and northwestern Thomas Counties through 330 AM CDT/230 AM MDT/... At 238 AM CDT/138 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cody to 7 miles southwest of Merritt Reservoir to 11 miles south of Mullen. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Cody, Kilgore, Seneca, Nenzel, Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Merritt Reservoir, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Eli, Steer Creek Campground, Schoolhouse Lake, Marsh Flat, Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Norway, Giant Hill, Highway 97 crossing Big Creek, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area and Kelso. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 150 and 184. Highway 2 between mile markers 177 and 207. Highway 97 between mile markers 57 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Thomas; Western Cherry
